sentences.sContent: Every new acronym I hear turns out to be another dirty trick designed to allow rich countries to go on with business as usual.
sentences.sContent_eng: Every new acronym I hear turns out to be another dirty trick designed to allow rich countries to go on with business as usual.
sentences.sCn: 我所听到的每个新缩写词原来都是另一个鬼把戏，旨在允许富裕国家照常进行一切活动。

sentences.sContent: Al is considered to be one of the first high profile commercial artists and his initials are also conveniently the acronym of the club.
sentences.sContent_eng: Al is considered to be one of the first high profile commercial artists and his initials are also conveniently the acronym of the club.
sentences.sCn: 铝被认为是第一个高调的商业艺术家之一，他的首字母是那么方便了俱乐部的首字母缩写。

remMethod.val: acro(顶端) + (o)nym(字， 词) → 把单词最顶端的字母放在一起 → 首字母缩写词

trans.tranOther: a word made up from the first letters of the name of something such as an organization. For example, NATO is an acronym for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
